00016 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00017 // D3DX_FILTER flags:
00018 // ------------------
00019 //
00020 // A valid filter must contain one of these values:
00021 //
00022 //  D3DX_FILTER_NONE
00023 //      No scaling or filtering will take place.  Pixels outside the bounds
00024 //      of the source image are assumed to be transparent black.
00025 //  D3DX_FILTER_POINT
00026 //      Each destination pixel is computed by sampling the nearest pixel
00027 //      from the source image.
00028 //  D3DX_FILTER_LINEAR
00029 //      Each destination pixel is computed by linearly interpolating between
00030 //      the nearest pixels in the source image.  This filter works best 
00031 //      when the scale on each axis is less than 2.
00032 //  D3DX_FILTER_TRIANGLE
00033 //      Every pixel in the source image contributes equally to the
00034 //      destination image.  This is the slowest of all the filters.
00035 //  D3DX_FILTER_BOX
00036 //      Each pixel is computed by averaging a 2x2(x2) box pixels from 
00037 //      the source image. Only works when the dimensions of the 
00038 //      destination are half those of the source. (as with mip maps)
00039 //
00040 // And can be OR'd with any of these optional flags:
00041 //
00042 //  D3DX_FILTER_MIRROR_U
00043 //      Indicates that pixels off the edge of the texture on the U-axis
00044 //      should be mirrored, not wraped.
00045 //  D3DX_FILTER_MIRROR_V
00046 //      Indicates that pixels off the edge of the texture on the V-axis
00047 //      should be mirrored, not wraped.
00048 //  D3DX_FILTER_MIRROR_W
00049 //      Indicates that pixels off the edge of the texture on the W-axis
00050 //      should be mirrored, not wraped.
00051 //  D3DX_FILTER_MIRROR
00052 //      Same as specifying D3DX_FILTER_MIRROR_U | D3DX_FILTER_MIRROR_V |
00053 //      D3DX_FILTER_MIRROR_V
00054 //  D3DX_FILTER_DITHER
00055 //      Dithers the resulting image using a 4x4 order dither pattern.
00056 //  D3DX_FILTER_SRGB_IN
00057 //      Denotes that the input data is in sRGB (gamma 2.2) colorspace.
00058 //  D3DX_FILTER_SRGB_OUT
00059 //      Denotes that the output data is in sRGB (gamma 2.2) colorspace.
00060 //  D3DX_FILTER_SRGB
00061 //      Same as specifying D3DX_FILTER_SRGB_IN | D3DX_FILTER_SRGB_OUT
00062 //
00063 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00064 
00065 #define D3DX_FILTER_NONE             (1 << 0)
00066 #define D3DX_FILTER_POINT            (2 << 0)
00067 #define D3DX_FILTER_LINEAR           (3 << 0)
00068 #define D3DX_FILTER_TRIANGLE         (4 << 0)
00069 #define D3DX_FILTER_BOX              (5 << 0)
00070 
00071 #define D3DX_FILTER_MIRROR_U         (1 << 16)
00072 #define D3DX_FILTER_MIRROR_V         (2 << 16)
00073 #define D3DX_FILTER_MIRROR_W         (4 << 16)
00074 #define D3DX_FILTER_MIRROR           (7 << 16)
00075 
00076 #define D3DX_FILTER_DITHER           (1 << 19)
00077 #define D3DX_FILTER_DITHER_DIFFUSION (2 << 19)
00078 
00079 #define D3DX_FILTER_SRGB_IN          (1 << 21)
00080 #define D3DX_FILTER_SRGB_OUT         (2 << 21)
00081 #define D3DX_FILTER_SRGB             (3 << 21)
00082 
00083 
00084 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00085 // D3DX_NORMALMAP flags:
00086 // ---------------------
00087 // These flags are used to control how D3DXComputeNormalMap generates normal
00088 // maps.  Any number of these flags may be OR'd together in any combination.
00089 //
00090 //  D3DX_NORMALMAP_MIRROR_U
00091 //      Indicates that pixels off the edge of the texture on the U-axis
00092 //      should be mirrored, not wraped.
00093 //  D3DX_NORMALMAP_MIRROR_V
00094 //      Indicates that pixels off the edge of the texture on the V-axis
00095 //      should be mirrored, not wraped.
00096 //  D3DX_NORMALMAP_MIRROR
00097 //      Same as specifying D3DX_NORMALMAP_MIRROR_U | D3DX_NORMALMAP_MIRROR_V
00098 //  D3DX_NORMALMAP_INVERTSIGN
00099 //      Inverts the direction of each normal 
00100 //  D3DX_NORMALMAP_COMPUTE_OCCLUSION
00101 //      Compute the per pixel Occlusion term and encodes it into the alpha.
00102 //      An Alpha of 1 means that the pixel is not obscured in anyway, and
00103 //      an alpha of 0 would mean that the pixel is completly obscured.
00104 //
00105 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00106 
00107 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00108 
00109 #define D3DX_NORMALMAP_MIRROR_U     (1 << 16)
00110 #define D3DX_NORMALMAP_MIRROR_V     (2 << 16)
00111 #define D3DX_NORMALMAP_MIRROR       (3 << 16)
00112 #define D3DX_NORMALMAP_INVERTSIGN   (8 << 16)
00113 #define D3DX_NORMALMAP_COMPUTE_OCCLUSION (16 << 16)
00114 
00115 
00116 
00117 
00118 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00119 // D3DX_CHANNEL flags:
00120 // -------------------
00121 // These flags are used by functions which operate on or more channels
00122 // in a texture.
00123 //
00124 // D3DX_CHANNEL_RED
00125 //     Indicates the red channel should be used
00126 // D3DX_CHANNEL_BLUE
00127 //     Indicates the blue channel should be used
00128 // D3DX_CHANNEL_GREEN
00129 //     Indicates the green channel should be used
00130 // D3DX_CHANNEL_ALPHA
00131 //     Indicates the alpha channel should be used
00132 // D3DX_CHANNEL_LUMINANCE
00133 //     Indicates the luminaces of the red green and blue channels should be 
00134 //     used.
00135 //
00136 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00137 
00138 #define D3DX_CHANNEL_RED            (1 << 0)
00139 #define D3DX_CHANNEL_BLUE           (1 << 1)
00140 #define D3DX_CHANNEL_GREEN          (1 << 2)
00141 #define D3DX_CHANNEL_ALPHA          (1 << 3)
00142 #define D3DX_CHANNEL_LUMINANCE      (1 << 4)
00143

00147 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00148 // D3DXIMAGE_FILEFORMAT:
00149 // ---------------------
00150 // This enum is used to describe supported image file formats.
00151 //
00152 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00153 
00154 typedef enum _D3DXIMAGE_FILEFORMAT
00155 {
00156     D3DXIFF_BMP         = 0,
00157     D3DXIFF_JPG         = 1,
00158     D3DXIFF_TGA         = 2,
00159     D3DXIFF_PNG         = 3,
00160     D3DXIFF_DDS         = 4,
00161     D3DXIFF_PPM         = 5,
00162     D3DXIFF_DIB         = 6,
00163     D3DXIFF_HDR         = 7,       //high dynamic range formats
00164     D3DXIFF_PFM         = 8,       //
00165     D3DXIFF_FORCE_DWORD = 0x7fffffff
00166 
00167 } D3DXIMAGE_FILEFORMAT;
00168 
00169 
00170 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00171 // LPD3DXFILL2D and LPD3DXFILL3D:
00172 // ------------------------------
00173 // Function types used by the texture fill functions.
00174 //
00175 // Parameters:
00176 //  pOut
00177 //      Pointer to a vector which the function uses to return its result.
00178 //      X,Y,Z,W will be mapped to R,G,B,A respectivly. 
00179 //  pTexCoord
00180 //      Pointer to a vector containing the coordinates of the texel currently 
00181 //      being evaluated.  Textures and VolumeTexture texcoord components 
00182 //      range from 0 to 1. CubeTexture texcoord component range from -1 to 1.
00183 //  pTexelSize
00184 //      Pointer to a vector containing the dimensions of the current texel.
00185 //  pData
00186 //      Pointer to user data.
00187 //
00188 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00189 
00190 typedef VOID (WINAPI *LPD3DXFILL2D)(D3DXVECTOR4 *pOut, 
00191     CONST D3DXVECTOR2 *pTexCoord, CONST D3DXVECTOR2 *pTexelSize, LPVOID pData);
00192 
00193 typedef VOID (WINAPI *LPD3DXFILL3D)(D3DXVECTOR4 *pOut, 
00194     CONST D3DXVECTOR3 *pTexCoord, CONST D3DXVECTOR3 *pTexelSize, LPVOID pData);
00195

00198 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00199 // D3DXIMAGE_INFO:
00200 // ---------------
00201 // This structure is used to return a rough description of what the
00202 // the original contents of an image file looked like.
00203 // 
00204 //  Width
00205 //      Width of original image in pixels
00206 //  Height
00207 //      Height of original image in pixels
00208 //  Depth
00209 //      Depth of original image in pixels
00210 //  MipLevels
00211 //      Number of mip levels in original image
00212 //  Format
00213 //      D3D format which most closely describes the data in original image
00214 //  ResourceType
00215 //      D3DRESOURCETYPE representing the type of texture stored in the file.
00216 //      D3DRTYPE_TEXTURE, D3DRTYPE_VOLUMETEXTURE, or D3DRTYPE_CUBETEXTURE.
00217 //  ImageFileFormat
00218 //      D3DXIMAGE_FILEFORMAT representing the format of the image file.
00219 //
00220 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00221 
00222 typedef struct _D3DXIMAGE_INFO
00223 {
00224     UINT                    Width;
00225     UINT                    Height;
00226     UINT                    Depth;
00227     UINT                    MipLevels;
00228     D3DFORMAT               Format;
00229     D3DRESOURCETYPE         ResourceType;
00230     D3DXIMAGE_FILEFORMAT    ImageFileFormat;
00231 
00232 } D3DXIMAGE_INFO;

00248 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00249 // GetImageInfoFromFile/Resource:
00250 // ------------------------------
00251 // Fills in a D3DXIMAGE_INFO struct with information about an image file.
00252 //
00253 // Parameters:
00254 //  pSrcFile
00255 //      File name of the source image.
00256 //  pSrcModule
00257 //      Module where resource is located, or NULL for module associated
00258 //      with image the os used to create the current process.
00259 //  pSrcResource
00260 //      Resource name
00261 //  pSrcData
00262 //      Pointer to file in memory.
00263 //  SrcDataSize
00264 //      Size in bytes of file in memory.
00265 //  pSrcInfo
00266 //      Pointer to a D3DXIMAGE_INFO structure to be filled in with the 
00267 //      description of the data in the source image file.
00268 //
00269 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00270 
00271 HRESULT WINAPI
00272     D3DXGetImageInfoFromFileA(
00273         LPCSTR                    pSrcFile,
00274         D3DXIMAGE_INFO*           pSrcInfo);
00275 
00276 HRESULT WINAPI
00277     D3DXGetImageInfoFromFileW(
00278         LPCWSTR                   pSrcFile,
00279         D3DXIMAGE_INFO*           pSrcInfo);
00280 
00281 #ifdef UNICODE
00282 #define D3DXGetImageInfoFromFile D3DXGetImageInfoFromFileW
00283 #else
00284 #define D3DXGetImageInfoFromFile D3DXGetImageInfoFromFileA
00285 #endif
00286 
00287 
00288 HRESULT WINAPI
00289     D3DXGetImageInfoFromResourceA(
00290         HMODULE                   hSrcModule,
00291         LPCSTR                    pSrcResource,
00292         D3DXIMAGE_INFO*           pSrcInfo);
00293 
00294 HRESULT WINAPI
00295     D3DXGetImageInfoFromResourceW(
00296         HMODULE                   hSrcModule,
00297         LPCWSTR                   pSrcResource,
00298         D3DXIMAGE_INFO*           pSrcInfo);

00317 // Load/Save Surface APIs ////////////////////////////////////////////////////

00320 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00321 // D3DXLoadSurfaceFromFile/Resource:
00322 // ---------------------------------
00323 // Load surface from a file or resource
00324 //
00325 // Parameters:
00326 //  pDestSurface
00327 //      Destination surface, which will receive the image.
00328 //  pDestPalette
00329 //      Destination palette of 256 colors, or NULL
00330 //  pDestRect
00331 //      Destination rectangle, or NULL for entire surface
00332 //  pSrcFile
00333 //      File name of the source image.
00334 //  pSrcModule
00335 //      Module where resource is located, or NULL for module associated
00336 //      with image the os used to create the current process.
00337 //  pSrcResource
00338 //      Resource name
00339 //  pSrcData
00340 //      Pointer to file in memory.
00341 //  SrcDataSize
00342 //      Size in bytes of file in memory.
00343 //  pSrcRect
00344 //      Source rectangle, or NULL for entire image
00345 //  Filter
00346 //      D3DX_FILTER flags controlling how the image is filtered.
00347 //      Or D3DX_DEFAULT for D3DX_FILTER_TRIANGLE.
00348 //  ColorKey
00349 //      Color to replace with transparent black, or 0 to disable colorkey.
00350 //      This is always a 32-bit ARGB color, independent of the source image
00351 //      format.  Alpha is significant, and should usually be set to FF for 
00352 //      opaque colorkeys.  (ex. Opaque black == 0xff000000)
00353 //  pSrcInfo
00354 //      Pointer to a D3DXIMAGE_INFO structure to be filled in with the 
00355 //      description of the data in the source image file, or NULL.
00356 //
00357 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00358 
00359 HRESULT WINAPI
00360     D3DXLoadSurfaceFromFileA(
00361         LPDIRECT3DSURFACE9        pDestSurface,
00362         CONST PALETTEENTRY*       pDestPalette,
00363         CONST RECT*               pDestRect,
00364         LPCSTR                    pSrcFile,
00365         CONST RECT*               pSrcRect,
00366         DWORD                     Filter,
00367         D3DCOLOR                  ColorKey,
00368         D3DXIMAGE_INFO*           pSrcInfo);
00369 
00370 HRESULT WINAPI
00371     D3DXLoadSurfaceFromFileW(
00372         LPDIRECT3DSURFACE9        pDestSurface,
00373         CONST PALETTEENTRY*       pDestPalette,
00374         CONST RECT*               pDestRect,
00375         LPCWSTR                   pSrcFile,
00376         CONST RECT*               pSrcRect,
00377         DWORD                     Filter,
00378         D3DCOLOR                  ColorKey,
00379         D3DXIMAGE_INFO*           pSrcInfo);
00380 
00381 #ifdef UNICODE
00382 #define D3DXLoadSurfaceFromFile D3DXLoadSurfaceFromFileW
00383 #else
00384 #define D3DXLoadSurfaceFromFile D3DXLoadSurfaceFromFileA
00385 #endif
00386 
00387 
00388

00390     D3DXLoadSurfaceFromResourceA(

00394         HMODULE                   hSrcModule,

00436 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00437 // D3DXLoadSurfaceFromSurface:
00438 // ---------------------------
00439 // Load surface from another surface (with color conversion)
00440 //
00441 // Parameters:
00442 //  pDestSurface
00443 //      Destination surface, which will receive the image.
00444 //  pDestPalette
00445 //      Destination palette of 256 colors, or NULL
00446 //  pDestRect
00447 //      Destination rectangle, or NULL for entire surface
00448 //  pSrcSurface
00449 //      Source surface
00450 //  pSrcPalette
00451 //      Source palette of 256 colors, or NULL
00452 //  pSrcRect
00453 //      Source rectangle, or NULL for entire surface
00454 //  Filter
00455 //      D3DX_FILTER flags controlling how the image is filtered.
00456 //      Or D3DX_DEFAULT for D3DX_FILTER_TRIANGLE.
00457 //  ColorKey
00458 //      Color to replace with transparent black, or 0 to disable colorkey.
00459 //      This is always a 32-bit ARGB color, independent of the source image
00460 //      format.  Alpha is significant, and should usually be set to FF for 
00461 //      opaque colorkeys.  (ex. Opaque black == 0xff000000)
00462 //
00463 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00464 
00465 HRESULT WINAPI
00466     D3DXLoadSurfaceFromSurface(
00467         LPDIRECT3DSURFACE9        pDestSurface,
00468         CONST PALETTEENTRY*       pDestPalette,
00469         CONST RECT*               pDestRect,
00470         LPDIRECT3DSURFACE9        pSrcSurface,
00471         CONST PALETTEENTRY*       pSrcPalette,
00472         CONST RECT*               pSrcRect,
00473         DWORD                     Filter,
00474         D3DCOLOR                  ColorKey);
00475

00477 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00478 // D3DXLoadSurfaceFromMemory:
00479 // --------------------------
00480 // Load surface from memory.
00481 //
00482 // Parameters:
00483 //  pDestSurface
00484 //      Destination surface, which will receive the image.
00485 //  pDestPalette
00486 //      Destination palette of 256 colors, or NULL
00487 //  pDestRect
00488 //      Destination rectangle, or NULL for entire surface
00489 //  pSrcMemory
00490 //      Pointer to the top-left corner of the source image in memory
00491 //  SrcFormat
00492 //      Pixel format of the source image.
00493 //  SrcPitch
00494 //      Pitch of source image, in bytes.  For DXT formats, this number
00495 //      should represent the width of one row of cells, in bytes.
00496 //  pSrcPalette
00497 //      Source palette of 256 colors, or NULL
00498 //  pSrcRect
00499 //      Source rectangle.
00500 //  Filter
00501 //      D3DX_FILTER flags controlling how the image is filtered.
00502 //      Or D3DX_DEFAULT for D3DX_FILTER_TRIANGLE.
00503 //  ColorKey
00504 //      Color to replace with transparent black, or 0 to disable colorkey.
00505 //      This is always a 32-bit ARGB color, independent of the source image
00506 //      format.  Alpha is significant, and should usually be set to FF for 
00507 //      opaque colorkeys.  (ex. Opaque black == 0xff000000)
00508 //
00509 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00510 
00511 HRESULT WINAPI
00512     D3DXLoadSurfaceFromMemory(
00513         LPDIRECT3DSURFACE9        pDestSurface,
00514         CONST PALETTEENTRY*       pDestPalette,
00515         CONST RECT*               pDestRect,
00516         LPCVOID                   pSrcMemory,
00517         D3DFORMAT                 SrcFormat,
00518         UINT                      SrcPitch,
00519         CONST PALETTEENTRY*       pSrcPalette,
00520         CONST RECT*               pSrcRect,
00521         DWORD                     Filter,
00522         D3DCOLOR                  ColorKey);
00523

00537 //  pSrcPalette

00539 //  pSrcRect
00540 //      Source rectangle, or NULL for the entire image
00541 //
00542 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00543

00598 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00599 // D3DXLoadVolumeFromFile/Resource:
00600 // --------------------------------
00601 // Load volume from a file or resource
00602 //
00603 // Parameters:
00604 //  pDestVolume
00605 //      Destination volume, which will receive the image.
00606 //  pDestPalette
00607 //      Destination palette of 256 colors, or NULL
00608 //  pDestBox
00609 //      Destination box, or NULL for entire volume
00610 //  pSrcFile
00611 //      File name of the source image.
00612 //  pSrcModule
00613 //      Module where resource is located, or NULL for module associated
00614 //      with image the os used to create the current process.
00615 //  pSrcResource
00616 //      Resource name
00617 //  pSrcData
00618 //      Pointer to file in memory.
00619 //  SrcDataSize
00620 //      Size in bytes of file in memory.
00621 //  pSrcBox
00622 //      Source box, or NULL for entire image
00623 //  Filter
00624 //      D3DX_FILTER flags controlling how the image is filtered.
00625 //      Or D3DX_DEFAULT for D3DX_FILTER_TRIANGLE.
00626 //  ColorKey
00627 //      Color to replace with transparent black, or 0 to disable colorkey.
00628 //      This is always a 32-bit ARGB color, independent of the source image
00629 //      format.  Alpha is significant, and should usually be set to FF for 
00630 //      opaque colorkeys.  (ex. Opaque black == 0xff000000)
00631 //  pSrcInfo
00632 //      Pointer to a D3DXIMAGE_INFO structure to be filled in with the 
00633 //      description of the data in the source image file, or NULL.
00634 //
00635 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00636 
00637 HRESULT WINAPI
00638     D3DXLoadVolumeFromFileA(
00639         LPDIRECT3DVOLUME9         pDestVolume,
00640         CONST PALETTEENTRY*       pDestPalette,
00641         CONST D3DBOX*             pDestBox,
00642         LPCSTR                    pSrcFile,
00643         CONST D3DBOX*             pSrcBox,
00644         DWORD                     Filter,
00645         D3DCOLOR                  ColorKey,
00646         D3DXIMAGE_INFO*           pSrcInfo);
00647 
00648 HRESULT WINAPI
00649     D3DXLoadVolumeFromFileW(
00650         LPDIRECT3DVOLUME9         pDestVolume,
00651         CONST PALETTEENTRY*       pDestPalette,
00652         CONST D3DBOX*             pDestBox,
00653         LPCWSTR                   pSrcFile,
00654         CONST D3DBOX*             pSrcBox,
00655         DWORD                     Filter,
00656         D3DCOLOR                  ColorKey,
00657         D3DXIMAGE_INFO*           pSrcInfo);
00658

00711 
00712 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00713 // D3DXLoadVolumeFromVolume:
00714 // -------------------------
00715 // Load volume from another volume (with color conversion)
00716 //
00717 // Parameters:
00718 //  pDestVolume
00719 //      Destination volume, which will receive the image.
00720 //  pDestPalette
00721 //      Destination palette of 256 colors, or NULL
00722 //  pDestBox
00723 //      Destination box, or NULL for entire volume
00724 //  pSrcVolume
00725 //      Source volume
00726 //  pSrcPalette
00727 //      Source palette of 256 colors, or NULL
00728 //  pSrcBox
00729 //      Source box, or NULL for entire volume
00730 //  Filter
00731 //      D3DX_FILTER flags controlling how the image is filtered.
00732 //      Or D3DX_DEFAULT for D3DX_FILTER_TRIANGLE.
00733 //  ColorKey
00734 //      Color to replace with transparent black, or 0 to disable colorkey.
00735 //      This is always a 32-bit ARGB color, independent of the source image
00736 //      format.  Alpha is significant, and should usually be set to FF for 
00737 //      opaque colorkeys.  (ex. Opaque black == 0xff000000)
00738 //
00739 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00740 
00741 HRESULT WINAPI
00742     D3DXLoadVolumeFromVolume(
00743         LPDIRECT3DVOLUME9         pDestVolume,
00744         CONST PALETTEENTRY*       pDestPalette,
00745         CONST D3DBOX*             pDestBox,
00746         LPDIRECT3DVOLUME9         pSrcVolume,
00747         CONST PALETTEENTRY*       pSrcPalette,
00748         CONST D3DBOX*             pSrcBox,
00749         DWORD                     Filter,
00750         D3DCOLOR                  ColorKey);
00751 
00752 
00753 
00754 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00755 // D3DXLoadVolumeFromMemory:
00756 // -------------------------
00757 // Load volume from memory.
00758 //
00759 // Parameters:
00760 //  pDestVolume
00761 //      Destination volume, which will receive the image.
00762 //  pDestPalette
00763 //      Destination palette of 256 colors, or NULL
00764 //  pDestBox
00765 //      Destination box, or NULL for entire volume
00766 //  pSrcMemory
00767 //      Pointer to the top-left corner of the source volume in memory
00768 //  SrcFormat
00769 //      Pixel format of the source volume.
00770 //  SrcRowPitch
00771 //      Pitch of source image, in bytes.  For DXT formats, this number
00772 //      should represent the size of one row of cells, in bytes.
00773 //  SrcSlicePitch
00774 //      Pitch of source image, in bytes.  For DXT formats, this number
00775 //      should represent the size of one slice of cells, in bytes.
00776 //  pSrcPalette
00777 //      Source palette of 256 colors, or NULL
00778 //  pSrcBox
00779 //      Source box.
00780 //  Filter
00781 //      D3DX_FILTER flags controlling how the image is filtered.
00782 //      Or D3DX_DEFAULT for D3DX_FILTER_TRIANGLE.
00783 //  ColorKey
00784 //      Color to replace with transparent black, or 0 to disable colorkey.
00785 //      This is always a 32-bit ARGB color, independent of the source image
00786 //      format.  Alpha is significant, and should usually be set to FF for 
00787 //      opaque colorkeys.  (ex. Opaque black == 0xff000000)
00788 //
00789 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00790 
00791 HRESULT WINAPI
00792     D3DXLoadVolumeFromMemory(
00793         LPDIRECT3DVOLUME9         pDestVolume,
00794         CONST PALETTEENTRY*       pDestPalette,
00795         CONST D3DBOX*             pDestBox,
00796         LPCVOID                   pSrcMemory,
00797         D3DFORMAT                 SrcFormat,
00798         UINT                      SrcRowPitch,
00799         UINT                      SrcSlicePitch,
00800         CONST PALETTEENTRY*       pSrcPalette,
00801         CONST D3DBOX*             pSrcBox,
00802         DWORD                     Filter,
00803         D3DCOLOR                  ColorKey);
00804

00815 //  DestFormat
00816 //      D3DXIMAGE_FILEFORMAT specifying file format to use when saving.
00817 //  pSrcVolume
00818 //      Source volume, containing the image to be saved
00819 //  pSrcPalette
00820 //      Source palette of 256 colors, or NULL
00821 //  pSrcBox
00822 //      Source box, or NULL for the entire volume
00823 //
00824 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00825 
00826 HRESULT WINAPI
00827     D3DXSaveVolumeToFileA(
00828         LPCSTR                    pDestFile,

00877 // Create/Save Texture APIs //////////////////////////////////////////////////
00879 
00880 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00881 // D3DXCheckTextureRequirements:
00882 // -----------------------------
00883 // Checks texture creation parameters.  If parameters are invalid, this
00884 // function returns corrected parameters.
00885 //
00886 // Parameters:
00887 //
00888 //  pDevice
00889 //      The D3D device to be used
00890 //  pWidth, pHeight, pDepth, pSize
00891 //      Desired size in pixels, or NULL.  Returns corrected size.
00892 //  pNumMipLevels
00893 //      Number of desired mipmap levels, or NULL.  Returns corrected number.
00894 //  Usage
00895 //      Texture usage flags
00896 //  pFormat
00897 //      Desired pixel format, or NULL.  Returns corrected format.
00898 //  Pool
00899 //      Memory pool to be used to create texture
00900 //
00901 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00902 
00903 HRESULT WINAPI
00904     D3DXCheckTextureRequirements(
00905         LPDIRECT3DDEVICE9         pDevice,
00906         UINT*                     pWidth,
00907         UINT*                     pHeight,
00908         UINT*                     pNumMipLevels,
00909         DWORD                     Usage,
00910         D3DFORMAT*                pFormat,
00911         D3DPOOL                   Pool);
00912 
00913 HRESULT WINAPI
00914     D3DXCheckCubeTextureRequirements(
00915         LPDIRECT3DDEVICE9         pDevice,
00916         UINT*                     pSize,
00917         UINT*                     pNumMipLevels,
00918         DWORD                     Usage,
00919         D3DFORMAT*                pFormat,
00920         D3DPOOL                   Pool);
00921 
00922 HRESULT WINAPI
00923     D3DXCheckVolumeTextureRequirements(
00924         LPDIRECT3DDEVICE9         pDevice,
00925         UINT*                     pWidth,
00926         UINT*                     pHeight,
00927         UINT*                     pDepth,
00928         UINT*                     pNumMipLevels,
00929         DWORD                     Usage,
00930         D3DFORMAT*                pFormat,
00931         D3DPOOL                   Pool);
00932 
00933 
00934 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00935 // D3DXCreateTexture:
00936 // ------------------
00937 // Create an empty texture
00938 //
00939 // Parameters:
00940 //
00941 //  pDevice
00942 //      The D3D device with which the texture is going to be used.
00943 //  Width, Height, Depth, Size
00944 //      size in pixels. these must be non-zero
00945 //  MipLevels
00946 //      number of mip levels desired. if zero or D3DX_DEFAULT, a complete
00947 //      mipmap chain will be created.
00948 //  Usage
00949 //      Texture usage flags
00950 //  Format
00951 //      Pixel format.
00952 //  Pool
00953 //      Memory pool to be used to create texture
00954 //  ppTexture, ppCubeTexture, ppVolumeTexture
00955 //      The texture object that will be created
00956 //
00957 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00958 
00959 HRESULT WINAPI
00960     D3DXCreateTexture(
00961         LPDIRECT3DDEVICE9         pDevice,
00962         UINT                      Width,
00963         UINT                      Height,
00964         UINT                      MipLevels,
00965         DWORD                     Usage,
00966         D3DFORMAT                 Format,
00967         D3DPOOL                   Pool,
00968         LPDIRECT3DTEXTURE9*       ppTexture);
00969 
00970 HRESULT WINAPI
00971     D3DXCreateCubeTexture(
00972         LPDIRECT3DDEVICE9         pDevice,
00973         UINT                      Size,
00974         UINT                      MipLevels,
00975         DWORD                     Usage,
00976         D3DFORMAT                 Format,
00977         D3DPOOL                   Pool,
00978         LPDIRECT3DCUBETEXTURE9*   ppCubeTexture);
00979 
00980 HRESULT WINAPI
00981     D3DXCreateVolumeTexture(
00982         LPDIRECT3DDEVICE9         pDevice,
00983         UINT                      Width,
00984         UINT                      Height,
00985         UINT                      Depth,
00986         UINT                      MipLevels,
00987         DWORD                     Usage,
00988         D3DFORMAT                 Format,
00989         D3DPOOL                   Pool,
00990         LPDIRECT3DVOLUMETEXTURE9* ppVolumeTexture);
00991 
00992 
00993 
00994 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00995 // D3DXCreateTextureFromFile/Resource:
00996 // -----------------------------------
00997 // Create a texture object from a file or resource.
00998 //
00999 // Parameters:
01000 //
01001 //  pDevice
01002 //      The D3D device with which the texture is going to be used.
01003 //  pSrcFile
01004 //      File name.
01005 //  hSrcModule
01006 //      Module handle. if NULL, current module will be used.
01007 //  pSrcResource
01008 //      Resource name in module
01009 //  pvSrcData
01010 //      Pointer to file in memory.
01011 //  SrcDataSize
01012 //      Size in bytes of file in memory.
01013 //  Width, Height, Depth, Size
01014 //      Size in pixels.  If zero or D3DX_DEFAULT, the size will be taken from 
01015 //      the file and rounded up to a power of two.  If D3DX_DEFAULT_NONPOW2, 
01016 //      and the device supports NONPOW2 textures, the size will not be rounded.
01017 //      If D3DX_FROM_FILE, the size will be taken exactly as it is in the file, 
01018 //      and the call will fail if this violates device capabilities.
01019 //  MipLevels
01020 //      Number of mip levels.  If zero or D3DX_DEFAULT, a complete mipmap
01021 //      chain will be created.  If D3DX_FROM_FILE, the size will be taken 
01022 //      exactly as it is in the file, and the call will fail if this violates 
01023 //      device capabilities.
01024 //  Usage
01025 //      Texture usage flags
01026 //  Format
01027 //      Desired pixel format.  If D3DFMT_UNKNOWN, the format will be
01028 //      taken from the file.  If D3DFMT_FROM_FILE, the format will be taken
01029 //      exactly as it is in the file, and the call will fail if the device does
01030 //      not support the given format.
01031 //  Pool
01032 //      Memory pool to be used to create texture
01033 //  Filter
01034 //      D3DX_FILTER flags controlling how the image is filtered.
01035 //      Or D3DX_DEFAULT for D3DX_FILTER_TRIANGLE.
01036 //  MipFilter
01037 //      D3DX_FILTER flags controlling how each miplevel is filtered.
01038 //      Or D3DX_DEFAULT for D3DX_FILTER_BOX,
01039 //  ColorKey
01040 //      Color to replace with transparent black, or 0 to disable colorkey.
01041 //      This is always a 32-bit ARGB color, independent of the source image
01042 //      format.  Alpha is significant, and should usually be set to FF for 
01043 //      opaque colorkeys.  (ex. Opaque black == 0xff000000)
01044 //  pSrcInfo
01045 //      Pointer to a D3DXIMAGE_INFO structure to be filled in with the 
01046 //      description of the data in the source image file, or NULL.
01047 //  pPalette
01048 //      256 color palette to be filled in, or NULL
01049 //  ppTexture, ppCubeTexture, ppVolumeTexture
01050 //      The texture object that will be created
01051 //
01052 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01053 
01054 
01055 // FromFile
01056 
01057 HRESULT WINAPI
01058     D3DXCreateTextureFromFileA(
01059         LPDIRECT3DDEVICE9         pDevice,
01060         LPCSTR                    pSrcFile,
01061         LPDIRECT3DTEXTURE9*       ppTexture);
01062 
01063 HRESULT WINAPI
01064     D3DXCreateTextureFromFileW(
01065         LPDIRECT3DDEVICE9         pDevice,
01066         LPCWSTR                   pSrcFile,
01067         LPDIRECT3DTEXTURE9*       ppTexture);
01068 
01069 #ifdef UNICODE
01070 #define D3DXCreateTextureFromFile D3DXCreateTextureFromFileW
01071 #else
01072 #define D3DXCreateTextureFromFile D3DXCreateTextureFromFileA
01073 #endif
01074

01587 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01588 // D3DXFilterTexture:
01589 // ------------------
01590 // Filters mipmaps levels of a texture.
01591 //
01592 // Parameters:
01593 //  pBaseTexture
01594 //      The texture object to be filtered
01595 //  pPalette
01596 //      256 color palette to be used, or NULL for non-palettized formats
01597 //  SrcLevel
01598 //      The level whose image is used to generate the subsequent levels. 
01599 //  Filter
01600 //      D3DX_FILTER flags controlling how each miplevel is filtered.
01601 //      Or D3DX_DEFAULT for D3DX_FILTER_BOX,
01602 //
01603 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01604 
01605 HRESULT WINAPI
01606     D3DXFilterTexture(
01607         LPDIRECT3DBASETEXTURE9    pBaseTexture,
01608         CONST PALETTEENTRY*       pPalette,
01609         UINT                      SrcLevel,
01610         DWORD                     Filter);
01611 
01612 #define D3DXFilterCubeTexture D3DXFilterTexture
01613 #define D3DXFilterVolumeTexture D3DXFilterTexture

01617 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01618 // D3DXFillTexture:
01619 // ----------------
01620 // Uses a user provided function to fill each texel of each mip level of a
01621 // given texture.
01622 //
01623 // Paramters:
01624 //  pTexture, pCubeTexture, pVolumeTexture
01625 //      Pointer to the texture to be filled.
01626 //  pFunction
01627 //      Pointer to user provided evalutor function which will be used to 
01628 //      compute the value of each texel.
01629 //  pData
01630 //      Pointer to an arbitrary block of user defined data.  This pointer 
01631 //      will be passed to the function provided in pFunction
01632 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01633 
01634 HRESULT WINAPI
01635     D3DXFillTexture(
01636         LPDIRECT3DTEXTURE9        pTexture,
01637         LPD3DXFILL2D              pFunction,
01638         LPVOID                    pData);
01639

01641     D3DXFillCubeTexture(
01642         LPDIRECT3DCUBETEXTURE9    pCubeTexture,
01643         LPD3DXFILL3D              pFunction,
01644         LPVOID                    pData);
01645 
01646 HRESULT WINAPI
01647     D3DXFillVolumeTexture(
01648         LPDIRECT3DVOLUMETEXTURE9  pVolumeTexture,
01649         LPD3DXFILL3D              pFunction,
01650         LPVOID                    pData);
01651 
01652 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
01653 // D3DXFillTextureTX:
01654 // ------------------
01655 // Uses a TX Shader target to function to fill each texel of each mip level
01656 // of a given texture. The TX Shader target should be a compiled function 
01657 // taking 2 paramters and returning a float4 color.
01658 //
01659 // Paramters:
01660 //  pTexture, pCubeTexture, pVolumeTexture
01661 //      Pointer to the texture to be filled.
01662 //  pTextureShader
01663 //      Pointer to the texture shader to be used to fill in the texture
01664 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01665 
01666 HRESULT WINAPI 
01667     D3DXFillTextureTX(
01668         LPDIRECT3DTEXTURE9        pTexture,
01669         LPD3DXTEXTURESHADER       pTextureShader);
01670 
01671

01673     D3DXFillCubeTextureTX(

01685 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01686 // D3DXComputeNormalMap:
01687 // ---------------------
01688 // Converts a height map into a normal map.  The (x,y,z) components of each
01689 // normal are mapped to the (r,g,b) channels of the output texture.
01690 //
01691 // Parameters
01692 //  pTexture
01693 //      Pointer to the destination texture
01694 //  pSrcTexture
01695 //      Pointer to the source heightmap texture 
01696 //  pSrcPalette
01697 //      Source palette of 256 colors, or NULL
01698 //  Flags
01699 //      D3DX_NORMALMAP flags
01700 //  Channel
01701 //      D3DX_CHANNEL specifying source of height information
01702 //  Amplitude
01703 //      The constant value which the height information is multiplied by.
01704 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
01705 
01706 HRESULT WINAPI
01707     D3DXComputeNormalMap(
01708         LPDIRECT3DTEXTURE9        pTexture,
01709         LPDIRECT3DTEXTURE9        pSrcTexture,
01710         CONST PALETTEENTRY*       pSrcPalette,
01711         DWORD                     Flags,
01712         DWORD                     Channel,
01713         FLOAT                     Amplitude);
